creditline: The Walter C. and Mary C. Briggs Endowment Fund and gift of the American Decorative Art 1900 Foundation
description: Arts and Crafts secretary with inlaid pewter and copper decoration on all drawers, doors, and exterior legs; 3 front drawers with metal knob handles; rectangular gallery with double doors (2 panels each, hinged) flanked by 3 vertical-stacked drawers on each side; gallery doors have latch closure interior of doors shows 9 compartments
medium: American white oak, pewter, copper, wood inlay
text: Beauty through simple materials was a hallmark of the Stickley style. Here, carefully chosen pieces of oak display unique wood grain. Metal and wood inlays provide a surprising pop of interest on the small folding doors in front and along the sides of the legs. Other fine details include the overhangs on the writing surface, referencing architecture, and the numerous drawers and doors for tidily storing pens, paper, stamps, and other writing supplies.
title: Desk
